fields.Transcription:
Kushto div√®s.  Miro nav Natalia Ivend hi, ta akaia yek beti filma trustal mande ta miri chib hi.

Me shom panj-var-desh-ta-dui bershengri Romani r√†ni, kater i svieti navesko Romanichal. Akaia svieti dui kotore la hi:
o Angliako Romanichal, ta o Irlandiako Romanichal. Komi sar panj shelbershipene p√†l√©, avelias miri familia kater i Karpatia, yekto ki Alemania, tala ki Fransia, ki Anglia, ta p√†l√© ki Irlandia ‚Äì kai sar bute k√†mipen, men rakhliem mari chib, ta as√† maro puro patchipen, p√†ske ko-div√®s.

Miri dialekta tatche pureni hi, ta nekana ne p√†ruvdias pes butoder sar bitipenes p√†l√© miri svieti muklias i Karpatia. Astis se i kono pureni Romani dialekta savi jivela komi.

Me ne jinava chi vaver familia savi rikeradias i puri Romanichaleski chib. S√†r e vaver Romanichaleske svietia nashavdie lengri chib bute, bute bershe p√†l√©, ta ken√† rokrelan m√® i chib navesko Angloromanes, vai ‚Äúi panghiadi chib‚Äù; adovo nav la hi soske li se tatche panghiadi ‚Äì neb√†khtale, li nashavdias s√†r laki gramatiki, ta bute lake nave, ta chivdias pes ketane ko Anglipen.  O Angloromanes kekomi yek tatchi Romani chib nai.

Me shom i p√†leni yek kater miri familia kon jivela komi ‚Äì me shom i kono t√†ni, ta s√†r e vaver mulie tai bershe p√†l√©. Doleske, astis shom i p√†leni yek kon jinela i puri Romanichaleski chib kater o beanipen. Me k√†mava te rakhava miri chib, ta te sikava la ke vaver mushe, te ne meravala; yek boro kotor kater mare purenipene hi.

As√† te k√®rava tai filmia trustal i chib, me buterava te k√®rava yek chibno-lil, savo rikeravala i chibake dui i gramatiki ta e lave.

Tumende me parikerava te shunelien mande, ta me k√†mava miro rokrapen te delias tumenge loshalipen.
fields.Translation:
Hello. My name is Natalia Ivend, and this is a short film about me and my language.

I am a 52-year-old Romani woman from the tribe named the 'Romanichal'. This tribe has two parts: the English Romanichal, and the Irish Romanichal. More than five centuries ago, my family came from Carpathia, first to Germany, then to France, England, and finally to Ireland, where we lovingly protected our language and also our old religion, to the present day.

My dialect is truly ancient, and has never changed more than fractionally since my tribe left Carpathia. It may be the most ancient still-living Romani dialect.

I don't know any other family who kept the old Romanichal language. All the other Romanichal clans lost their language many, many years ago and now only speak a language known as Angloromanes, or 'the broken language' it has that name because it truly is broken ‚Äì unfortunately, it lost all its grammar and many of its words, and became mixed together with English. Angloromanes is no longer a true Romani language.

I am the last one of my family who is still living ‚Äì I am the youngest, and all the others died some years ago. Therefore, it's possible that I am the last native speaker of the old Romanichal language. I want to save my language and to teach it to other people, so that it will not die out; it is a big part of our heritage.

As well as making some films about the language, I am working to create a lexicon of the language, which will document both the grammar and the vocabulary.

Thank you for listening to me, and I hope you enjoyed my talk.
fields.Speaker Notes: Claims to be the last speaker; credible claims of fraudulence were raised
Demographics: 40,400 in Czech Republic (2011 census). Population total all countries: 151,500.
YouTube License Statement: This video is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International license. To download a copy, please contact hello@wikitongues.org.
fields.Geneaology: "[ Indo-European, Indo-Iranian, Indo-Aryan, Central zone, Romani, Northern ]"
